Experiment Method.Assay Method: Reporter gene assay (EGFP with let-7-binding sites)

Material used.Material Name: Transgenic flies and mice with EGFP reporter
Material used.Description: Generated EGFP reporter with let-7-binding sites in the 3'UTR for measuring microRNA regulation.

Readout description.Result Description: I1915T mutation in LRRK2 led to elevated EGFP expression in transgenic models.
G2019S mutation in LRRK2 caused heightened EGFP expression compared to wild-type.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Loss-of-function (reduced reporter activity in kinase-dead mutants)
Readout description.Result Description: Kinase-dead dLRRK(I1915T) showed reduced EGFP activity compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 used as a control in reporter assays.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or non-targeting RNAi used as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: EGFP expression within 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: EGFP expression deviating by â‰¥20% from wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: Used CRISPR/Cas9 or P-element insertion for knockout and transgenic expression.

Readout description.Result Description: I1915T mutation in transgenic flies disrupted normal LRRK2 signaling pathways.
G2019S mutation in transgenic flies caused neurodegenerative phenotypes.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic negative control.Description: Flies without transgene used as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No observable phenotypic changes compared to wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of neurodegenerative or behavioral phenotypes.
